reviews.review_msg: She's okay, but her exams are based all on memorization. If you use an example that's not from the notes you'll get it wrong. Basically, she tests on how well you memorized her notes. Her TA isn't that good either.

Dr. Bernstein is awesome! Her lectures are interesting even though she just reads off the slides. Her exams are fair; short-answers are easy but MC are a little tricky (since it is from the textbook test bank)

Liked this prof- she uses power points & lots of videos to supplement (but not tested on) her notes. Exams were pretty much out of the textbook- attendance is not mandatory but she makes it interesting. TA's marked HARD, maybe cus she marked it within 3 days?

The material of this course is pretty easy, very similar to introductory abnormal psyc. However, her exams were sometimes difficult because she uses a bank of questions from the textbook. They are very picky questions, do the practice ones online. Short answers are very easy though. Either way, class is curved so just do better than everyone else.

I really enjoyed her method of teaching, she was spunky and used lots of clips to illustrate points! I disliked how she used test banks from the textbook for exams, and the performance of the class on the MC was quite low.

I really enjoyed this course. The prof really knows the subject well. 2 midterms and 1 final - that's it, no paper! Really good format. This course was graded on a curve, which I liked. Study and go to class and you'll do well. I found that I had to read the textbook fully and take notes to do well.

Classes are boring: reads off the slides and shows too many youtube videos. You can pretty much skip lecture all together because her powerpoints are useless too. Tutorials are useless but mandatory. Her exams are hard (likes the tricky m/c). Great class though but if you can, take the class with a different prof!

She is a nice instructor but her exams are far too difficult. If you do not think her way then you will not pass the written part. Majority failed the written part which was unexpected. Majority of this class did poorly, students complained, and the grades were scaled but that didn't help much. Ask for clarification or take another instructor.
Interesting teacher but exams far too difficult; she had to scale the grades, which is something I haven't had done in a upper division psyc course yet!
No Comments
very knowledgeable prof. very patient, and the lecture was so interesting. tests could be hard though.

This class looked interesting but became incredibly boring. Save yourself some time and just read the text...her lectures are a repeat. Test are hard and even if you think you know the material, she will ask questions in a way that makes you feel like you don't. Bad class!!!
All you're getting in her class is a repeat of the text aside from case studies and videos. Textbook info, textbook style. Rather boring.

Dr. Young is awesome! She is kind of a hard-ass, and really takes her subject seriously, so don't take her class if you just want an easy arts credit. But she is very accessible and great when you meet with her outside of class. This lady is really smart!
I can't believe how boring this woman is!
Martin is great. Great sense of humor and respect his students. Providing lecture recording which is must be listened for second time for a good grade. The grading is fair. Highly recommended.

Martin is very real in his lectures and doesn't sugar coat anything. He enjoys participation and will always play devils advocate. He makes you look at psychology, disorders/illnesses, and treatments in a while new light. Take if you want to expand your ideas. TA sucked, was rude, and graded poorly. Beware.

HIGHLY recommend this prof. Martin reminded me why I love psychology and his lectures are really interesting. He really makes you think, as opposed to just regurgitating info. No textbook so make sure you take good notes and understand the key ideas he's trying to get across. He does tend to digress but it's usually a funny or interesting story!
Martin is a G. His lectures are really funny & interesting, doesnt use a textbook. The essay is fun and he is an easy marker. Would def take a class w/him again.
Take a class with him!  His class really helps you understand people, and he challenges assumptions in psychology and mental health, which makes for really interesting lectures.

Really great prof! lectures are recorded so if you miss one it's really helpful to go back and listen to the recording. No textbook for the class and the lecture slides are not super detailed. Make sure you listen and take notes. I missed classes and still did really well, but I took the time to listen to recordings to study for exams.

no textbookreadings, entirely based on lec & slides. likes to "hide" infotrick those not in class (although it's nothing major), because he wants to reward those who comes to the 830 class. a bit quirky but very interesting & super hilarious. high expectations for students. very tricky exams. recommend listening to lec recordings & take notes!

I really appreciated Martin's lecture style and his lived experiences and stories.  Made me remember why I decided upon studying psychology in the first place.  Listening to class lectures for a second time did not feel tedious at all, extremely interesting, human down-to-earth lecturer.  I will miss this class terribly.

In response to the person below who thinks Daniella was a bad T.A., I had a totally different experience. She replied promptly to all my emails, was available for a very convenient scheduled time to meet and go over my exam with me and gave me so many helpful tips which helped me ace the class. She was a great T.A., and Martin was a brilliant prof.
Great guy, great class.
HE IS AMAZING. Honestly such a great, smart man. Makes you look at Psychology in a way you never have. So sad this class is over.

Martin has become my favourite prof at SFU. So insightful and approachable. So relatable to students and really makes you think. He values critical thinking and skepticism over many issues in psychology, rare in a a psychology professor today. He isn't the "memorize & repeat" guy. If you have a chance to take his classes, please do it.

Don't take his lecture unless u think u are an effective learner in the lecture room. No reading, sounds sweet... but the truth was that u have no pathway to follow.. his lectures might be fun... but i found it just "too fun" to be a lecture... all i remember in classes were jokes and jokes..

Martin is truly hilarious and he really cares about the students but he is serious about the material! You have to really dig deep to do well on the exams as the MC can be confusing a lot of the time. What I love about Martin is that he is a practicing psychologist so we get real-world examples of what we talk about in class, which I love a lot.

LOVE his lecture! It was a 8:30am lecture but you won't fall asleep because he is SUPER HILARIOUS! He loves to talk about the stories from his clinical profession background. Must attend lecture because he likes to turn off his mic when it comes to sensitive  controversial topics (you dont wanna miss that cuz usually he got a point).
Best prof I've ever had. So insightful and hilarious. Could listen to him talk all day oh my goodness.

I thought he was great! Very entertaining lectures, and he's hot (in a nerdy kinda way!) It was not mandatory to attend lectures as they were recorded but It's more fun if you go. Best prof in the Psyc department hands down!

His lectures were interesting because he uses lots of examples, but the exam was fairly unreasonable. Most of the questions were extremely similar so you have to think extra hard. Memorizing the material from lecture will definitely not get you anywhere
Is a fun teacher but there were discrepancies between the lecture and the exam.

This prof's lectures had absolutely no sturcture to them. If you want to do well...read the test he uses the stock exam from it. Memorize facts like percentages and dates. I was really dissapointed with this class because it is a topic I am interested in and I feel I didn't get my $ worth!!  but it's an easy grade if you memorize well!
I love Prof. Ley.  He's just great.

Bob was really fun to listen to in class, his stories are great. but...if you want to get a better mark than I did- read the book. I was a little shocked when basically nothing from lectures were on the tests. Other than that it was a good class.
Tests are difficult.  Lectures do not really reflect exams.

I enjoyed him for Psyc 355 but not for this course! This course was HARD and his lectures were not that interesting like they are in Psyc 355. Term paper was difficult and tutorials were a complete waste of time! I must say I was looking forward to this class but was very disappointed at the end of the semester

GREATEST PROFESSOR EVER!  He has a real passion for what he does.  Lectures are very interesting and you learn and remember A LOT from the course.  Wish there were more profs like him!!  Tests are straight forward as is the paper/presentation (you actually get a choice).  Tutorials are informative.
Very straightforward. Tested pretty much entirely from text. Very psychoanalytically oriented. An easy A.
